concept.title: DITA2Confluence distribution overview
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes the DITA2Confluence distributions.

conbody.p:
The DITA2Confluence tool is available in the following distribution packages:
Binary distribution (for users)
Source distribution (for contributors)

row.entry: File containing the Ant build logic. Takes confluence.config.xml and confluence.content.xml files as inputs.
Describes the wiki environment at the system level (where and how to publish DITA XML content)

entry.p: Describes what to publish (declares one or more content modules). A content module equals a DITA map.
Includes the dita2confluence module which publishes the DITA2Confluence user guide (this documentation) to the target wiki.
An XSD schema for parsing/verification of config file specified.
An XSD schema for parsing/verification of content mapping file specified.

row.entry: Created when you run the tool, and updated on subsequent runs. By default, logging is set to INFO. To configure what information is logged, edit files/log4j.xml (see online documentation for log4j).

Contains the rules for transforming DITA XML markup to wikitext markup (dita2wml.xsl, toc.xsl) and for logging (log4j.xml). The dtd subfolder contains a convenience copy of the DITA DTDs for faster processing out of the box.
Executable Java archive files, including the main dita2confluence.jar file which performs internal processing as well as remote API communication with the wiki.
Routine classes actually performing import process.
RPC exception classes required for proper functionality.
SOAP bean classes representing remote Confluence entities.
SOAP service stub classes. Auto-generated by WSDL2Java tool then updated to perform required remote operations.
Utility classes representing generic widely-used Confluence entity.
